_comment: Created by rreed on 25/05/2017 13:34:42 using v2.7
title: Has the distribution of sickness absence changed?
analysis_commentary:
Between 2011 and 2016 the trend in this chart has remained relatively steady. The latest data shows the largest percentage of staff (44% in 2016) took zero sickness days. There was a noticeable increase of 4 percentage points in the proportion of staff taking no sickness days from 2013 to 2014. A substantial 7% of employees had more than 40 sick days in 2016.

Updated April 2017.
data_source: NHS Digital, Personal Social Services: Staff of Social Services Departments
